column3: NOT A SPELL. A workaround for pcgen to mark open slots.
You fire a small orb of acid at the target dealing 1d3 points of acid damage.
This spell allows you to inscribe your personal rune or mark.
You create up to four lights that resemble lanterns or torches.
You detect magical auras.
You determine whether a creature, object, or area has been poisoned or is poisonous.
This cantrip creates a burst of light.
Ghost sound allows you to create a volume of sound that rises, recedes, approaches, or remains at a fixed place.
You surround yourself with disturbing illusions.
This spell causes a touched object to glow like a torch.
You point your finger at an object and can lift it and move it at will from a distance.
This spell repairs damaged objects, restoring 1d4 hit points to the object.
You can whisper messages and receive whispered replies.
You can open or close (your choice) a door, chest, box, window, bag, pouch, bottle, barrel, or other container.
Prestidigitations are minor tricks that novice spellcasters use for practice.
A ray of freezing air and ice projects from your pointing finger dealing 1d3 points of cold damage.
You can decipher magical inscriptions on objects--books, scrolls, weapons, and the like--that would otherwise be unintelligible.
You imbue the subject with magical energy that protects it from harm, granting it a +1 resistance bonus on saves.
Ignites flammable objects.
NOT A SPELL. A workaround for pcgen to mark open slots.
Alarm creates a subtle ward on an area you select.
Target takes a -20 penalty on its next attack roll or check.
A cone of searing flame shoots from your fingertips dealing (min(5,CASTERLEVEL))d4 points of fire damage to any creature in the effect area.
This charm makes a humanoid creature regard you as its trusted friend and ally.
A vivid cone of clashing colors springs forth from your hand, causing creatures to become stunned, perhaps also blinded, and possibly knocking them unconscious.
You can detect secret doors, compartments, caches, and so forth.
A creature protected by endure elements suffers no harm from being in a hot or cold environment.
Erase removes writings of either magical or mundane nature from a scroll or from one or two pages of paper, parchment, or similar surfaces.
The affected creatures or objects fall slowly.
A grease spell covers a solid surface with a layer of slippery grease.
Anoint a wounded creature with devil's blood or unholy water giving it fast healing 1. Does not repair silver or good damage. Target detects as evil for the duration.
Target makes an Escape Artist check as an immediate action and gains a bonus on it.
An invisible but tangible field of force surrounds the subject of a mage armor spell, providing a +4 armor bonus to AC.
(min((CASTERLEVEL+1)/2,5)) missiles that do 1d4+1 damage each.
This spell causes instant diminution of a humanoid creature, halving its height, length, and width and dividing its weight by 8.
Shield creates an invisible shield of force that hovers in front of you.
Your successful melee touch attack deals (min(5,CASTERLEVEL))d6 points of electricity damage.
This spell summons an extraplanar creature.
Swim speed becomes 30 ft.
This spell functions like invisibility. Like invisibility, the spell immediately ends if the subject attacks any creature.
NOT A SPELL. A workaround for pcgen to mark open slots.
The affected creature gains greater vitality and stamina granting the subject a +4 enhancement bonus to Constitution.
The subject becomes stronger granting a +4 enhancement bonus to Strength.
The transmuted creature becomes more graceful, agile, and coordinated granting a +4 enhancement bonus to Dexterity.
The transmuted creature becomes more poised, articulate, and personally forceful gaining a +4 enhancement bonus to Charisma.
You harness the power of unlife to grant yourself a limited ability to avoid death.
A burning globe of fire rolls in whichever direction you point and burns those it strikes.
The target becomes smarter granting a +4 enhancement bonus to Intelligence.
A cloud of golden particles covers everyone and everything in the area, causing creatures to become blinded and visibly outlining invisible things for the duration of the spell.
A twisting pattern of subtle, shifting colors weaves through the air, fascinating creatures within it.
Knock opens stuck, barred, or locked doors, as well as those subject to hold portal or arcane lock.
Levitate allows you to move yourself, another creature, or an object up and down as you wish.
This spell creates a number of illusory doubles of you that inhabit your square.
The transmuted creature becomes wiser gaining a +4 enhancement bonus to Wisdom.
The warded creature gains resistance to ranged weapons.
When this spell is cast upon a piece of rope from 5 to 30 feet ,long, one end of the rope rises into the air until the whole rope hangs perpendicular to the ground, as if affixed at the upper end.
NOT A SPELL. A workaround for pcgen to mark open slots.
Creates rolling sphere of water.
You can use dispel magic to end one ongoing spell that has been cast on a creature or object, to temporarily suppress the magical abilities of a magic item, or to counter another spellcaster's spell.
A fireball spell generates a searing explosion of flame that detonates with a low roar and deals (min(10,CASTERLEVEL))d6 points of fire damage to every creature within the area.
The subject can fly at a speed of 60 feet (or 40 feet if it wears medium or heavy armor, or if it carries a medium or heavy load).
The subject and all its gear become insubstantial, misty, and translucent.
The transmuted creatures move and act more quickly than normal.

This spell functions like invisibility, except that this spell confers invisibility upon all creatures within 10 feet of the recipient at the time the spell is cast. The center of the effect is mobile with the recipient.
You release a powerful stroke of electrical energy that deals (min(10,CASTERLEVEL))d6 points of electricity damage to each creature within its area.
An affected creature moves and attacks at a drastically slowed rate.

This spell functions as create pit, except that the pit is lined with wickedly sharp spikes along its bottom and walls. Creatures who fall into the pit take falling damage as normal, plus 2d6 points of piercing damage from the spikes. Any creature or object coming into contact with the spikes along the walls, such as a creature trying to climb out, or rope or other typical aids to climbing, takes 1d6 points of piercing damage each round they are in contact with the walls. For those willing to accept the damage incurred while climbing, the pit's walls have a Climb DC of 20.
Stinking cloud creates a bank of fog like that created by fog cloud, except that the vapors are nauseating.
You influence the actions of the target creature by suggesting a course of activity.

This spell functions like summon monster I, except that you can  summon one creature from the 3rd-level list, 1d3 creatures of the same kind from the 2nd-level list, or 1d4+1 creatures of the same kind from the 1st-level list.
The transmuted creatures can breathe water freely.
NOT A SPELL. A workaround for pcgen to mark open slots.
Creates a pit with a layer of acid on the bottom.
This spell causes a field of rubbery black tentacles to appear, burrowing up from the floor and reaching for any creature in the area.
This spell causes confusion in the targets, making them unable to determine their actions.
A green ray springs from your hand, any creature or object struck by the ray is covered with a shimmering emerald field that completely blocks extradimensional travel.
You instantly transfer yourself from your current location to any other spot within range.
Creates a hemispherical dome of force similar to Wall of Force.
This spell functions like invisibility, except that it doesn't end if the subject attacks.
Works as magic aura, but including willing creatures

You create an extradimensional link between yourself and one summoned creature you control that allows you to switch places. After casting master’s escape, you can teleport to your summoned creature’s space as a swift action, causing your summoned creature to teleport to your former space. If your summoned creature is reduced to 0 or fewer hit points before you can use this spell’s effect, you can teleport to a space that you can see within 30 feet as an immediate action. After using either of these effects, the spell ends. A summoner can target his eidolon with this spell.

You create a phantasmal image of the most fearsome creature imaginable to the subject simply by forming the fears of the subject's subconscious mind into something that its conscious mind can visualize: this most horrible beast.
Target can breathe water and swim.
The warded creature gains resistance to blows, cuts, stabs, and slashes.

This spell functions like summon monster I, except that you can summon one creature from the 4th-level list, 1d3 creatures of the same kind from the 3rd-level list, or 1d4+1 creatures of the same kind from a lower-level list.
This spell creates an anchored plane of ice or a hemisphere of ice, depending on the version selected.
NOT A SPELL. A workaround for pcgen to mark open slots.
As beast shape III, except that you change the subject into a Small or smaller animal of no more than 1 HD.
This spell generates a bank of fog, similar to a fog cloud, except that its vapors are yellowish green and poisonous.
Target creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores each drop to 1.
This spell functions like hold person, except that it affects any living creature that fails its Will save.
As create pit, but dealing 4d6 damage to those in it as it closes.
Thick ice holds and damages the target.
Targets in a line take (min(CASTERLEVEL,15))d6 electricity damage.
This spell functions like a fly spell, except you can fly at a speed of 40 feet (30 feet if wearing medium or heavy armor, or if carrying a medium or heavy load).
You create a passage through wooden, plaster, or stone walls, but not through metal or other harder materials.

This spell functions like summon monster I, except that you can summon one creature from the 5th-level list, 1d3 creatures of the same kind from the 4th-level list, or 1d4+1 creatures of the same kind from a lower-level list.
You move objects or creatures by concentrating on them.
This spell instantly transports you to a designated destination, which may be as distant as 100 miles per caster level.
A wall of force creates an invisible wall of pure force.
NOT A SPELL. A workaround for pcgen to mark open slots.
An invisible barrier impervious to most magical effects surrounds you and moves with you.
This spell creates an electrical discharge that begins as a single stroke commencing from your fingertips.
A thin, green ray springs from your pointing finger dealing (min(40,CASTERLEVEL*2))d6 points of damage.
This spell restores a petrified creature to its normal state, restoring life and goods.
Converts the top layer of the ground into hot tar.
